law.text:
Any witness who fails, without legal excuse, to attend or to testify, when required by the chief state school officer under these provisions, shall be fined not more than twenty-five dollars ($25) for each offense.
Any person who violates any of the provisions of KRS 156.400 to 156.470 shall be fined not more than five hundred dollars ($500) or imprisoned not more than three
months, or both. (3) A violation of subsection (1) of KRS 156.483 shall cause the Department of Education to be fined not less than five hundred dollars ($500) or more than one thousand dollars ($1,000).
law.history: Amended 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 476, Pt. IV, sec. 168, effective July 13, 1990. -- Amended 1988 Ky. Acts ch. 345, sec. 6, effective July 15, 1988. -- Created 1952 Ky. Acts ch. 184, sec. 16.

metadata.former-history: Repealed 1952 Ky. Acts ch. 184, sec. 17. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. secs. 4384-15, 4421a-46.
